components.description:
Ardoq offers a comprehensive REST\-api as well as wrappers for selected programming languages. You can use the REST\-api to integrate with Ardoq, for example to automate documentation, or to create custom tools that make use of data from Ardoq.

[You'll surely find it helpful to be familiar with the concepts within Ardoq before you start working with the API](https://ardoq.com/help-category/getting-started/). If anything is unclear, you can always reach us through the chat in the lower right corner.
components.name: Introduction

components.description:
When authorizing with our REST API, you can choose between Token-based or Basic authentication. 

Remember, that if you wish to query your dedicated organization, [you will need to use your organization key](comp://576285be72fa6d4461ea8e26/).

**Gotcha:** In order to access the full api a user needs Read and Write permissions.
components.name: Authorization

components.description:
> **Example**: Request all the workspaces in the 'piedpiper' organization, remember to replace `7424d725f9a6430692bb4fb1da56d4f4` with your own token
```shell
curl \
  -H "Accepts: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Token token=7424d725f9a6430692bb4fb1da56d4f4" \
  -X GET "https://app.ardoq.com/api/workspace?org=piedpiper"
```
> Response
```json collapse in
> Status: 200
> Content-type: application/json;charset=UTF-8

[{
    "components": [
        "5273b181e4b0556c6de507db",
        "5273b185e4b0556c6de507dd",
        "5273b18de4b089f51935b771",
        "5273b192e4b089f51935b773",
        "52caea2ce4b0da0ff65eca23"
    ],
    "componentModel": "51fc9f883004a73fd64d2188",
    "created-by": "520383b8e4b0836fe8d5ee62",
    "name": "ArdoqTest",
    "references": [
        "5273b1a2e4b0556c6de507df"
    ],
    "created": "2013-11-01T14:48:52.121+01:00",
    "type": "1",
    "_id": "5273b144e4b0556c6de507d9",
    "last-updated": "2014-01-06T18:38:52.994+01:00",
    "description": "Example description",
    "_version": 11,
    "tags": []
},
...
]

```

If you have access to a dedicated organization in Ardoq, you can access it by appending the URL requested with the `org` parameter.

[Sign in to your account](https://app.ardoq.com), switch to your organization then open the _API and Tokens_ tab in your preferences to find your _organization key_.

  
![](https://d2rfz2e29xc0q.cloudfront.net/api/attachment/workspace/55af6ae2e4b052d8aabf83ac/api-token-organization-key.png?org=shared)

Now you can append the API endpoints you access with `?org=yourOrganizationKey` \(normally it defaults to `ardoq`\).
components.name: Access Your Organization

components.description:
In Ardoq, every resource is versioned. This is to ensure that your older documentation is preserved and it is possible to roll back to previous versions in the future.

Every resource has a `_version` attribute and it is incremented and returned whenever you perform a PUT request. In general, when performing PUT requests, you must ensure to pass the most recently returned `_version` number.

If you try to update a resource and pass a lesser `_version` you will encounter a **500 Error: Optimistic Locking Exception**. This means that the resource has been updated since you last read the `_version` and you must GET it to get the most recent updates.
components.name: Versioning

components.description:
#### Full Document Response
**Gotcha:** Per REST standards, the API expects the full document when you update an object, otherwise the fields will be reset to their null values (a PUT request is essentially a "replace" operation).

Thus, ***API-Generated*** are created and updated by the back-end, but you still have to include them when you perform updates to a resource.

|Attribute|Type|Description||
|name|`String`|Name of workspace|*Required*|
|description|`String`|Text field describing the workspace, 
supports markdown and simple HTML markup|*Required*|
|componentModel|`String`|Id of the model the workspace is based on|*Required* if no componentTemplate|
|componentTemplate|`String`|Id of the template the workspace is based on|*Required* if no componentModel|
|folder|`String`|Id of the folder the workspace belongs to|*Optional*|
|views|`[String]`|Ids of the in-app views the workspace should be loaded with|*Optional*|
|workspace-key|`String`|A unique human-readable identifier for the workspace|*API-Generated*|
|comp-counter|`Integer`|Number of components in the workspace|*API-Generated*|
|components|`[String]`|Array of component\-Ids belonging to the workspace|*API-Generated*|
|references|`[String]`|Array of reference\-Ids belonging to the workspace, including outgoing references to other workspaces|*API-Generated*|
|incoming-references|`[String]`|Array of reference\-Ids from other workspaces, targeting components in this workspace|*API-Generated*|
|linked-workspaces|`[String]`|Array of workspace\-Ids that link to the workspace by incoming or outgoing references|*API-Generated*|
|incoming-components|`[String]`|Array of referenced to component\-Ids from a different workspace|*API-Generated*|
|outgoing-components|`[String]`|Array component\-Ids that reference to a different workspace|*API-Generated*|
|tags|`[String]`|Array of tag\-IDs belonging to the workspace|*API-Generated*|
|created|`String`|Timestamp of when the workspace was created i.e \`"2015\-10\-18T09:51:58.282\+02:00"|*API-Generated*|
|created\-by|`String`|Id of the user who created the workspace|*API-Generated*|
|createdByName|`String`|Name of the user who created the workspace|*API-Generated*|
|createdByEmail|`String`|Email of the user who created the workspace|*API-Generated*|
|last\-updated|`String`|Timestamp of the last update i.e \`"2015\-10\-18T09:51:58.282\+02:00"|*API-Generated*|
|last-modified\-by|`String`|Id of the user who last modified the workspace|*API-Generated*|
|lastModifiedByName|`String`|Name of the user who last modified the workspace|*API-Generated*|
|lastModifiedByEmail|`String`|Email of the user who last modified the workspace|*API-Generated*|
|\_version|`Integer`|Version counter, incremented every time the workspace changes|*API-Generated*|
|\_id|`String`|The unique ID of the object|*API-Generated*|

**Gotcha:** Per REST standards, the API expects the full document when you update an object, otherwise the fields will be reset to their null values (a PUT request is essentially a "replace" operation).

Thus, ***API-Generated*** are created and updated by the back-end, but you still have to include them when you perform updates to a resource.

#### Full Document Response

|Attribute|Type|Description||
|name|`String`|Name of the component|*Required*|
|description|`String`|Text field describing the component, supports markdown and simple HTML markup|*Required*|
|rootWorkspace|`String`|Id of the workspace the component belongs to|*Required*|
|parent|`String`|Id of the component's parent, defaults to null (top-level)|*Optional*|
|typeId|`String`|Id of the component's type, defaults to inferring the type from the model|*Optional*|
|type|`String`|Name of the component's type, inferred from the type Id|*API-Generated*|
|_order|`Float`|The ordering of the component relevant to its siblings|*API-Generated*|
|component-key|`String`|A unique human-readable identifier for the component|*API-Generated*|
|model|`String`|Id of the model the component belongs to, is inferred from the component|*API-Generated*|
|children|`[String]`|Array of component\-Ids|*API-Generated*|
|created|`String`|Timestamp of when the component was created i.e \`"2015\-10\-18T09:51:58.282\+02:00"|*API-Generated*|
|created\-by|`String`|Id of the user who created the component|*API-Generated*|
|createdByName|`String`|Name of the user who created the component|*API-Generated*|
|createdByEmail|`String`|Email of the user who created the component|*API-Generated*|

Find components by one or more fields. A field matches if the field equals the query. If multiple fields are passed it will return components where all fields match.

**Note:** partial matches are not returned.

|Method|URL|
|GET|`/api/component/search?workspace={workspaceid}&{field_name}={field_value}?org=ardoq`|

|Parameter|Description|
|org|Organization to search in, defaults to Personal|
|workspace|Required: ID of workspace components must belong to|
|field\_name=field\_value|name \- value pairs. ie. `parent=5332cf93b0c6c6e1a40ec937`|
components.name: Find by Field Values

components.description:
**Gotcha:** Per REST standards, the API expects the full document when you update an object, otherwise the fields will be reset to their null values (a PUT request is essentially a "replace" operation).

Thus, ***API-Generated*** are created and updated by the back-end, but you still have to include them when you perform updates to a resource.

#### Full Document Response

|Attribute|Type|Description||
|source|`String`|Id of the source component|*Required*|
|target|`String`|Id of the target component|*Required*|
|type|`Integer`|Type \(as defined by the model\) i.e. Synchronous, Implicit etc.|*Required*|
|displayText|`String`|Short label describing the reference, is visible in some visualizations
|*Optional*|
|description|`String`|Text field describing the reference, 
supports markdown and simple HTML markup|*Optional*|
|order|`Integer`|The order of the reference relevant to the others, relevant for some step-based visualizations|*Optional*|
|returnValue|`Boolean`|Determines whether the reference returns a value|*Optional*|
|rootWorkspace|`String`|Id of the source component's workspace|*API-Generated*|
|targetWorkspace|`String`|Id of the target component's workspace|*API-Generated*|
|created|`String`|Timestamp of when the reference was created i.e \`"2015\-10\-18T09:51:58.282\+02:00"|*API-Generated*|
|created\-by|`String`|Id of the user who created the reference|*API-Generated*|
|createdByName|`String`|Name of the user who created the reference|*API-Generated*|
|createdByEmail|`String`|Email of the user who created the reference|*API-Generated*|
|last\-updated|`String`|Timestamp of last update i.e \`"2015\-10\-18T09:51:58.282\+02:00"|*API-Generated*|
|last-modified\-by|`String`|Id of the user who last modified the reference|*API-Generated*|
|lastModifiedByName|`String`|Name of the user who last modified the reference|*API-Generated*|
|lastModifiedByEmail|`String`|Email of the user who last modified the reference|*API-Generated*|
|\_version|`Integer`|Version counter, incremented every time the reference changes|*API-Generated*|
|\_id|`String`|The unique ID of the object|*API-Generated*|

components.description:
**Gotcha:** Per REST standards, the API expects the full document when you update an object, otherwise the fields will be reset to their null values (a PUT request is essentially a "replace" operation).

Thus, ***API-Generated*** are created and updated by the back-end, but you still have to include them when you perform updates to a resource.

#### Full Document Response
|Attribute|Type|Description||
|filename|`String`|Filename of the attachment|*Inferred from the file*|
|folder|String|Id of the folder the attachment belongs to|`Optional`|
|uri|`String`|Uri|*API-Generated*|
|size|`Integer`|Size of the attachment in bytes|*API-Generated*|
|created|`String`|Timestamp of when the attachment was created i.e \`"2015\-10\-18T09:51:58.282\+02:00"|*API-Generated*|
|created\-by|`String`|Id of the user who created the attachment|*API-Generated*|
|createdByName|`String`|Name of the user who created the attachment|*API-Generated*|
|createdByEmail|`String`|Email of the user who created the attachment|*API-Generated*|
|last\-updated|`String`|Timestamp of last update i.e \`"2015\-10\-18T09:51:58.282\+02:00"|*API-Generated*|
|last-modified\-by|`String`|Id of the user who last modified the field|*API-Generated*|
|lastModifiedByName|`String`|Name of the user who last modified the field|*API-Generated*|
|lastModifiedByEmail|`String`|Email of the user who last modified the field|*API-Generated*|
|\_version|`Integer`|Version counter, incremented every time the field changes|*API-Generated*|
|\_id|`String`|The unique ID of the object|*API-Generated*|

components.description:
##### Tests
In order to run the tests you need an Ardoq account. You also need to generate a security token and edit the settings in `ArdoqTest.Helper.TestUtils` to fit your configuration.
components.name: Contributing

components.description:
### /api/workspace

Ardoq groups documentation into workspaces. A workspace contains all the resources that Ardoq needs to render the textual and visual documentation.

This page assumes that are you are fairly familiar with workspaces, but you can [read more here if you would like to learn about the underlying concept of workspaces](https://ardoq.com/help/workspace/).

#### A note on models and workspaces
The Workspace/Model API will soon undergo changes in relation to creating workspaces based on a model, so you are better off creating workspaces in the app as of now.
components.name: Workspace

components.description: To organize the workspaces in a user's dashboard, you can put them in folders. Currently, folders can only be one level deep.
components.name: WorkspaceFolder

components.description:
### /api/component

This page assumes that are you are fairly familiar with components, but you can [read more here if you would like to learn about the underlying concept of components](https://ardoq.com/help/component/).
components.name: Component

components.description:
*Due to planned changes in the model\-API and data format we recommend users to create models using the application untill the changes are completed.*

If you wish to find the reference types or type IDs, you can issue a GET request to `/api/model/` or `/api/model/{model-id}`, but keep in mind that the model API isn't stable.

**Feel free to contact us via the chat in the bottom right corner if you'd like to know more.**
components.name: Model

components.description:
### /api/reference

References describe relationship between components. References can have types \(defined by the model\) to represent different kinds of relationship i.e. Synchronized or Asynchroinzed.

[You can read more about the concepts of references here.](https://ardoq.com/help/references/)
components.name: Reference

components.description:
###/api/tag

Tags are a simple way to group and filter information. In large workspaces tags are a powerful way to group related information together and keep the visualizations easier to understand by applying filters based on one or more tags.

[You can read more about the concept of tags here.](https://ardoq.com/help/tags/)
components.name: Tag

components.description:
### /api/field

> Technically, field values are stored as custom attributes on the component's payload like this:

```json collapse in
{
...
 "name": "createOrder",
 "maintainer: "erik@ardoq.com",
...
 }

```
> But first they have to be defined and created, since they are a first-class resource belonging to the model.

Fields are a way to add additional attributes on components. These attributes can be used in search and filtering, and makes it possible to highlight important information. A typical example of a field is to add a maintainer.

[You can read more about fields here.](https://ardoq.com/help/fields/)

**Note:** Fields are created in the model automatically when you add fields in the Ardoq App, but if you are adding fields via the REST-api, you should keep in mind that fields are firstly first-class attributes belonging to the model.

You must create and define a field with corresponding component and reference types on a model, before you set the field value on components.

**Gotcha:** When you create a field using the REST API, it will not be added to all the corresponding components and references. If you have a defaultValue you would like to apply, you would have to do so manually (this is handled on the client-side in the Ardoq app).
components.name: Field

components.description:
### /api/attachment

Attachments let's you upload existing artefacts like documents \(word,pdf, etc\), images or movies and include them in your documentation either as links or \(for images\) directly in the textual documentation.
components.name: Attachment

components.description:
**Gotcha:** Per REST standards, the API expects the full document when you update an object, otherwise the fields will be reset to their null values (a PUT request is essentially a "replace" operation).

Thus, ***API-Generated*** are created and updated by the back-end, but you still have to include them when you perform updates to a resource.

#### Full Document Response

|Attribute|Type|Description||
|name|`String`|Name of the folder|*Required*|
|description|`String`|Text field describing the folder|*Optional*|
|parent|`String`|Id of the parent folder|*Optional*|
|workspaces|`[String]`|Ids of the workspaces in the folder|*Optional*|
|created|`String`|Timestamp of when the workspace was created i.e \`"2015\-10\-18T09:51:58.282\+02:00"|*API-Generated*|
|created\-by|`String`|Id of the user who created the folder|*API-Generated*|
|createdByName|`String`|Name of the user who created the folder|*API-Generated*|
|createdByEmail|`String`|Email of the user who created the folder|*API-Generated*|
|last\-updated|`String`|Timestamp of the last update i.e \`"2015\-10\-18T09:51:58.282\+02:00"|*API-Generated*|
|last-modified\-by|`String`|Id of the user who last modified the folder|*API-Generated*|
|lastModifiedByName|`String`|Name of the user who last modified the folder|*API-Generated*|
|lastModifiedByEmail|`String`|Email of the user who last modified the folder|*API-Generated*|
|\_version|`Integer`|Version counter, incremented every time the folder changes|*API-Generated*|
|\_id|`String`|The unique ID of the object|*API-Generated*|

components.description:
**Gotcha:** Per REST standards, the API expects the full document when you update an object, otherwise the fields will be reset to their null values (a PUT request is essentially a "replace" operation).

Thus, ***API-Generated*** are created and updated by the back-end, but you still have to include them when you perform updates to a resource.


#### Allowed field types
|Type|Description|
|"Text"|A string|
|"TextArea"|A longer string|
|"DateTime"|A date timestamp (in RFC3339 format), i.e `"2016-04-04T22:00:00.000Z"`|
|"CheckBox"|A boolean|
|"User"|E-mail string of an Ardoq user within the same organization, i.e. `erlich.bachman@aviato.com`|
|"email"|Valid e-mail address (string)|
|"url"|Valid URL (string)|

**Gotcha**: The field type restrictions are validated on the client-side, which means that while the Ardoq App tries to render approriate information for i.e. the "CheckBox" field, if a client has set an invalid user value, it won't be enforced to be valid by the API.|

#### Full Document Response

|Attribute|Type|Description||
|name|`String`|Name of the field. Must correspond with attribute name on the
component|*Required*|
|model|`String`|Id of the model the field belongs to|*Required*|
|type|`String`| Field type, used to customize rendering and validate field values in the Ardoq App|*Required*|
|defaultValue|`Anything`|The default value of the field, which will be applied to the creation of components or references in the Ardoq App (not enforced by the back-end). The type depends on the field type|*Optional*|
|label|`String`| Label can be used to make a more human-readable name, is API-generated if left blank|*Optional*|
|required|`Boolean`| Whether the field value is allowed to be empty|*Optional*|
|componentType|`[String]`| Array of component type ids the field should be applied to |*Optional*|
|componentType|`[String]`| Array of reference type ids the field should be applied to |*Optional*|
|global| `Boolean` | Overrides the componentType array and allows the field to be set for all the component types |*Optional*|
|globalRef| `Boolean` | Overrides the referenceType array and allows the field to be set for all the reference types |*Optional*|
|created|`String`|Timestamp of when the field was created i.e \`"2015\-10\-18T09:51:58.282\+02:00"|*API-Generated*|
|created\-by|`String`|Id of the user who created the field|*API-Generated*|
|createdByName|`String`|Name of the user who created the field|*API-Generated*|
|createdByEmail|`String`|Email of the user who created the field|*API-Generated*|
|last\-updated|`String`|Timestamp of last update i.e \`"2015\-10\-18T09:51:58.282\+02:00"|*API-Generated*|
|last-modified\-by|`String`|Id of the user who last modified the field|*API-Generated*|
|lastModifiedByName|`String`|Name of the user who last modified the field|*API-Generated*|
|lastModifiedByEmail|`String`|Email of the user who last modified the field|*API-Generated*|
|\_version|`Integer`|Version counter, incremented every time the field changes|*API-Generated*|
|\_id|`String`|The unique ID of the object|*API-Generated*|

components.description:
**NB:** Webhooks are currently in private beta. To request access, please contact us at `contact@ardoq.com`.

  
Webhooks allows you to register custom "callbacks" that will be called with an HTTP POST request whenever something changes in Ardoq.

To install go to Preferences -> Organization settings -> Manage organization -> Webhooks and register you Webhook URL.

**TIPS**: You can explore webhooks by using the free service [http://requestb.in/](http://requestb.in/)

> Example `POST` request made to webhook

```json
{
  "resource-type": "workspace",
  "resource-id": "5857d0f072fa6d5f475cf917",
  "event-type": "create”,
  "organization": "57e4d10172fa6d7c41720d7c",
  "organization-label": "demoerik",
  "data": {
    … //workspace document
    ]
  }
}
```
